moves.1. e4 c5: sicilian defense... and since its the only defense i know for kp, i use it.  like it too.
moves.2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nc3 g6: i dont remember why i did this
moves.7... d5: attack f4 and opens up bishop
moves.10. Bb5: attacks my knight and queen pins it
moves.10... a6: attacks bishop and forces it to move or trade
moves.13. b3 Qb4+ 14. Qd2 Qe4: move to safety and take a central position
moves.18... Nf5: bunch of random stuff till around move 30 or so
moves.34. e7: but at the expense of a rook
moves.37. Qxd5: watch the turn of events over the next 17 moves...
moves.37... Qe7 38. Qd2 Ng4 39. Re1 Qh4 40. Qc: here is where it gets interesting...
moves.48. a4 Ne5 49. Qb5 Nd7 50. Rc6 Ne5 51. R: sweet!  I advanced my pawn farther than his a4 pawn!
And for the bumble of the century...
moves.61. Qd7+ Qf7 62. Qxf7+ Kxf7 63. Rxe2: and i learned a lesson from this ... dont set up too many conditional moves when you have a significant advantage just because you only have dial up internet... think things out and take it slow.  GRRRRR!!!!!  I think my play at 54 was quite good though.  Comments???
